info.title: Notion API
info.description: Notion API 2025-09-03 - Data Source Edition. Breaking change: Database endpoints replaced with data source endpoints.

tags.name: Data sources
tags.description: Data source endpoints for querying and managing databases

tags.name: Pages
tags.description: Page endpoints for creating and managing pages

tags.name: Blocks
tags.description: Block endpoints for managing page content

get.summary: Retrieve user information by ID (name, avatar, type, email)
get.description: Returns information about a user by their ID, including name, avatar, and type (person or bot). Authentication is pre-configured. Useful for looking up user details after finding user IDs in page properties (created_by, last_edited_by, people properties) or comment authors. For person users, includes email if available. Use 'get-users' to list all workspace users if you don't have a specific ID.

get.summary: List all workspace users (person users and bot integrations) with pagination
get.description: Returns a paginated list of all users in the workspace, including both person users and bot integrations. Authentication is pre-configured. Useful for finding user IDs to filter database queries by person properties or to identify comment authors. Supports pagination via start_cursor.

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

get.summary: Retrieve bot user information for this MCP server connection
get.description: Returns information about the bot user for this MCP server connection, including owner information. Authentication is already configured - you do not need to provide tokens or credentials.

post.summary: Search workspace for pages and data sources by title
post.description: Searches across the workspace for pages and data sources by title - typically the first step when finding content by name. Authentication is pre-configured. Results include [page:id] or [db:id] references which you should use with 'retrieve-a-page', 'retrieve-a-data-source', or 'get-block-children' to access the actual content or metadata. Can filter results to only pages or only data sources using filter.property='object' and filter.value='page'|'data_source'. Results ordered by relevance or last_edited_time (configurable via sort parameter). Supports pagination via start_cursor for workspaces with many results.

query.description: The text that the API compares page and database titles against.

sort.description: A set of criteria, `direction` and `timestamp` keys, that orders the results. The **only** supported timestamp value is `"last_edited_time"`. Supported `direction` values are `"ascending"` and `"descending"`. If `sort` is not provided, then the most recently edited results are returned first.

direction.description: The direction to sort. Possible values include `ascending` and `descending`.

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against. Possible values include `last_edited_time`.

filter.description: A set of criteria, `value` and `property` keys, that limits the results to either only pages or only data sources. Possible `value` values are `"page"` or `"data_source"`. The only supported `property` value is `"object"`.

value.description: The value of the property to filter the results by.  Possible values for object type include `page` or `data_source`.  **Limitation**: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

property.description: The name of the property to filter by. Currently the only property you can filter by is the object type.  Possible values include `object`.   Limitation: Currently the only filter allowed is `object` which will filter by type of object (either `page` or `data_source`)

start_cursor.description: A `cursor` value returned in a previous response that If supplied, limits the response to results starting after the `cursor`. If not supplied, then the first page of results is returned. Refer to [pagination](https://developers.notion.com/reference/intro#pagination) for more details.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list to include in the response. Maximum: `100`.

get.summary: Retrieve block/page content as markdown (text, images, lists, etc.)
get.description: Returns the child blocks (actual content) of a parent block or page. This is how you retrieve the text, images, lists, and other content from a page - 'retrieve-a-page' only returns metadata. Authentication is pre-configured. The block_id parameter accepts both block IDs and page IDs, so to get a page's content, pass the page_id here. Returns blocks formatted as readable markdown with inline [block:id] tags you can reference in 'update-a-block', 'delete-a-block', or 'patch-block-children'. Nested blocks are shown with proper hierarchy. For pages with many blocks, supports pagination via start_cursor when has_more is true - use the returned next_cursor to fetch remaining content.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block)

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

patch.summary: Append new content blocks to end of a block or page
patch.description: Appends new content blocks to the end of a parent block or page. Authentication is pre-configured. The block_id parameter accepts both block IDs and page IDs, so you can add content to a page by passing its page_id. The children parameter is an array of block objects to append. New blocks are added after any existing content. Returns the updated block with the new children. Use 'update-a-block' to modify existing block content instead of appending.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a [block](ref:block). Also accepts a [page](ref:page) ID.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of [block objects](ref:block)

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

get.summary: Retrieve single block properties by ID (without child blocks)
get.description: Returns a single block by ID with its properties and content. Authentication is pre-configured. Does not include child blocks - use 'get-block-children' to retrieve those. Useful for inspecting a specific block's properties after finding its [block:id] reference in 'get-block-children' output. For most use cases, 'get-block-children' provides better context by showing blocks with their hierarchy.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

patch.summary: Update block content (text, checked status) or archive/restore
patch.description: Updates the content of an existing block. Authentication is pre-configured. Currently only text content (for supported block types like paragraph, heading, bulleted_list_item, etc.) and checked status (for to_do blocks) can be updated. Can also archive (delete) or restore blocks via the archived property. Use the [block:id] reference from 'get-block-children' output to identify which block to update. To append new blocks instead of modifying existing ones, use 'patch-block-children'.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

type.description: The [block object `type`](ref:block#block-object-keys) value with the properties to be updated. Currently only `text` (for supported block types) and `checked` (for `to_do` blocks) fields can be updated.

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

delete.summary: Delete block by archiving (soft delete, can be restored)
delete.description: Deletes a block by setting it as archived (soft delete). Authentication is pre-configured. The block is not permanently removed but moved to trash, allowing recovery later. Use the [block:id] reference from 'get-block-children' output to identify which block to delete. To restore a deleted block, use 'update-a-block' with archived: false.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block

get.summary: Retrieve page metadata and properties (not content - use get-block-children for that)
get.description: Returns page metadata and properties (title, URL, icon, cover, database property values, timestamps) but NOT the page's content/text. Authentication is pre-configured. This is useful for inspecting page properties without fetching the full content, or as a second step after 'post-search' to verify you have the right page before fetching content. To retrieve the actual content (headings, paragraphs, lists, etc.), follow up with 'get-block-children' using this page's ID. For database pages (pages in a data source), property values are returned in Notion's structured format - you may need 'retrieve-a-page-property' for very large property values. Response includes [page:id] reference for use in other operations. Can optionally filter returned properties with filter_properties parameter.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: Limits which properties are returned - omit to get all properties including title. Specify property IDs, e.g. `?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh`.

patch.summary: Update page properties (title, icon, cover, database values) or archive/restore
patch.description: Updates properties of a page such as title, icon, cover, or data source property values. Authentication is pre-configured. For data source pages, only updates the property values - does not modify the data source schema itself. To update the actual content/text on the page, use 'patch-block-children' (to append) or 'update-a-block' (to modify existing blocks). Can also archive (delete) or restore pages via the archived property. Use the [page:id] reference from search or other operations.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) or [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object).

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only [external file objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object) are supported.

post.summary: Create page as child of another page or as data source row
post.description: Creates a new page as a child of another page or as a row in a data source. Authentication is pre-configured. The parent parameter specifies where to create: use {page_id: 'xxx'} for child pages or {database_id: 'xxx'} for data source rows. For data source pages, the properties must match the data source schema - call 'retrieve-a-data-source' first to see required properties and their types. For standalone pages, typically only a title property is needed. Can optionally include initial content via the children parameter (array of block objects). Returns the newly created page with [page:id] reference. Icon and cover are optional.

children.description: The content to be rendered on the new page, represented as an array of [block objects](https://developers.notion.com/reference/block).

icon.description: The icon of the new page. Either an [emoji object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/emoji-object) or an [external file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object)..

cover.description: The cover image of the new page, represented as a [file object](https://developers.notion.com/reference/file-object).

get.summary: Retrieve specific page property value (for large properties with pagination)
get.description: Returns the value of a specific page property by property_id. Authentication is pre-configured. Use this when a property value is too large to be included in the page object returned by 'retrieve-a-page' (common for long rich text, large relation arrays, or rollup properties with many items). The property_id can be found in the page's properties object from 'retrieve-a-page'. Supports pagination via start_cursor for properties that return lists (relations, rollup arrays). Most simple properties (title, select, number, date, checkbox, etc.) are fully returned in 'retrieve-a-page' and don't require this separate call.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page

parameters.name: property_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a page [property](https://developers.notion.com/reference/page#all-property-values)

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: For paginated properties.

get.summary: Retrieve unresolved comments from a page or block with pagination
get.description: Retrieves a list of unresolved comments from a page or block. Authentication is pre-configured. The block_id parameter accepts both page IDs and block IDs - use a [page:id] reference to get comments on a page or [block:id] to get comments on a specific block. Only returns comments that haven't been resolved/marked as done. Returns comments with text, author, timestamps, and discussion thread IDs. Supports pagination via start_cursor for pages with many comments. Use 'create-a-comment' to add new comments or reply to existing discussion threads.

parameters.name: block_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

parameters.name: start_cursor
parameters.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

parameters.name: page_size
parameters.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

post.summary: Create new comment on page or reply to existing discussion thread
post.description: Creates a new comment on a page or adds a reply to an existing discussion thread. Authentication is pre-configured. The parent parameter specifies the page using page_id - use a [page:id] reference from search or other operations. The rich_text parameter is an array of rich text objects containing the comment text. To reply to an existing comment, include the discussion_id from that comment. New top-level comments start a new discussion thread. Returns the created comment with its ID and discussion thread information.

parent.description: The page that contains the comment

post.summary: Query data source pages/rows with optional filtering, sorting, and pagination
post.description: Returns pages (rows) from a data source (database), optionally filtered and sorted. Authentication is pre-configured. Does not return the data source schema - call 'retrieve-a-data-source' first to see available properties, their types, and select options. Filter and sort parameters reference property names from that schema. Filtering supports different operators per property type: text properties (equals, contains, starts_with), select/status (equals), numbers (equals, greater_than, less_than), dates (before, after), checkbox (equals true/false). Use 'and' or 'or' arrays to combine up to 100 filter conditions. Results are pages with their property values - use 'get-block-children' on returned [page:id] references to see the actual page content. Supports pagination via start_cursor for data sources with many pages (max 100 per request). Use filter_properties query parameter to limit which page properties are returned if you only need specific fields.

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source (database)

parameters.name: filter_properties
parameters.description: Limits which properties (columns) are returned per page - does NOT filter which pages match. Omit to get all properties including titles. To filter pages, use the 'filter' body parameter instead.

filter.description: Filter conditions for querying the data source

get.summary: Retrieve data source schema (column definitions, types, and configuration)
get.description: Returns data source schema (structure/column definitions) including title, description, icon, and the property schema for all columns. Authentication is pre-configured. Each property includes its name, type (title, select, multi_select, date, number, relation, rollup, etc.), and type-specific configuration (e.g., select option names and colors, number format, relation target data source). Does not return the actual pages/rows - use 'query-data-source' to retrieve those. The property names and types returned here are essential when: (1) creating new pages in this data source via 'post-page' (properties must match schema), (2) constructing filters in 'query-data-source' (filter property names must match these), (3) understanding what data the data source contains. Response includes [db:id] reference. This is typically called before querying or adding to a data source.

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

patch.summary: Update data source metadata and schema (add, rename, or remove columns)
patch.description: Updates data source metadata including title, description, icon, and property schema (add, rename, or remove columns). Authentication is pre-configured. Does not update the pages/rows within the data source - use 'patch-page' to update individual page property values. When modifying the schema, existing pages are updated to reflect the new structure. Use the [db:id] reference from search or other operations. Returns the updated data source schema.

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

post.summary: Create data source with schema (columns/properties) as child of a page
post.description: Creates a new data source (database/table) as a child of an existing page. Authentication is pre-configured. The parent parameter must specify a page_id. The properties parameter defines the data source schema (columns) - each property needs a name and type (title, select, multi_select, date, number, checkbox, url, email, phone_number, relation, rollup, etc.). At least one title property is required. After creation, use 'post-page' with this data source's ID to add rows/pages. The data source inherits sharing permissions from the parent page. Returns the new data source with [db:id] reference. Title, description, icon, and cover are optional.

get.summary: List available templates in a data source for new page creation
get.description: Lists available page templates within a data source. Authentication is pre-configured. Templates are pre-configured page layouts that can be used when creating new pages in this data source. Returns template pages with their IDs and properties. Supports pagination via start_cursor for data sources with many templates. Use the template information when creating new pages via 'post-page' to provide a starting structure.

parameters.name: data_source_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion data source

post.summary: Move page to a different parent (page, data source, or workspace)
post.description: Moves a page to a different parent location in your workspace. Authentication is pre-configured. The parent parameter specifies the new location - use {type: 'page_id', page_id: 'xxx'} to move under another page, {type: 'database_id', database_id: 'xxx'} to move into a data source, or {type: 'workspace'} to move to workspace top-level. When moving to a data source, the page must have properties that match the data source schema. Use the [page:id] reference from search or other operations.

parameters.name: page_id
parameters.description: Identifier for a Notion page
